channel.title: Is there any

item.title: Is there any
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

errrmmmm, you’d do sumting like dis, but the other shit is to stop caching so you get a new result every time.

[php]header(“Cache-Control: no-cache, must-revalidate”); // HTTP/1.1
header(“Expires: Tue, 01 Jan 2000 12:12:12 GMT”); // Date in the past
header(“Pragma: no-cache”);
header(‘Content-Type: image/png’); // change to image/jpg for jpeg, image/gif for gif, etc.

if ((@fsockopen($host_array[0],$host_array[1],$errorNumber,$errorMessage,10)) != null) {
$file = “./path/to/online.png”;
} else {
$file = “./path/to/offline.png”;
}

header('Content-Length: ’ . filesize($file));
ob_clean();
flush();
readfile($file);
exit;[/php]

Read full topic

item.title: Is there any
item.dc:creator: @cumescape cumescape
item.description:
@cumescape wrote:

Is there any easyer way to make this an image but still keep the online and offline thing in there?

http://zyberscape.com/aaronsgetotest.php
[php]

<?php // checks if the server is online or offline $i = "255.255.255.255"; $p = "6000"; $c = @fsockopen($i, $p, $ERRNO, $ERRSTR, 1); // create a 741*17 image $online = imagecreate(741, 17); $offline = imagecreate(741, 17); // text variables $bg = imagecolorallocate($im, 0, 0, 0); $textcolor = imagecolorallocate($im, 0, 160, 0); $bg2 = imagecolorallocate($im2, 0, 0, 0); $textcolor2 = imagecolorallocate($im2, 255, 40, 0); imagestring($online, 5, 0, 0, " On" , $textcolor); imagestring($offline, 5, 0, 0, " Off" , $textcolor2); // output the image header("Content-type: image/png"); if($c) { echo imagepng($online); } else { echo imagepng($offline); } ?>

[/php]

Read full topic
